data.title: Clark James Gable, ‘Cheaters’ Host and Clark Gable’s Grandson Dies at 30
data.meta_description: Clark Gable’s grandson and the host of ‘Cheaters’ was found dead the morning of Feb. 22, 2019. He was 30 years old. TMZ is reporting that the actor was found in bed unresponsive by his fiance. He was transported to Dallas’ Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital and was pronounced dead. His sister Kayley Gable confirmed the […]
data.text:
Clark Gable’s grandson and the host of ‘Cheaters’ was found dead the morning of Feb. 22, 2019. He was 30 years old.

TMZ is reporting that the actor was found in bed unresponsive by his fiance. He was transported to Dallas’ Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital and was pronounced dead. His sister Kayley Gable confirmed the actor’s death on her Facebook. She wrote:

My brother was found unresponsive by his fiance, and he did not wake up. “I LOVE YOU CLARKIE I’m so sorry we could not save you. My heart is broken and shattered RIP.

Tracy Yarro Scheff, Gable’s mother, wrote on her Instagram:

It is with a heavy heart we say goodbye to my beautiful son Clark. He died this morning. I will always be next to you my son. Mom.

Gable is also the grandson of Clark Cable who is best known for his roles in “Gone With The Wind,” “It Happened One Night,” and “Mutiny on the Bounty.”

In 2011, the “Cheaters” star was arrested for pointing a laser pointer at an LAPD helicopter. He pled guilty and spent ten days in jail. Also, in 2009, he was stabbed while at a party in L.A.

Written by Barbara Sobel

Sources:

Variety: Clark Gable’s Grandson, Who Hosted ‘Cheaters,’ Found Dead at 30

EW: Clark Gable’s grandson, Cheaters host Clark James Gable, dies at 30

People: Clark Gable’s Grandson, Cheaters Host Clark James Gable, Dies at 30
